title: Video Games That Teach History
summary: Total War is a popular video game series where players act as historical leaders to manage armies and resources, aiming to conquer the world. It has sold over 35 million copies and features settings like ancient Rome and feudal Japan. The developers work hard to make the games accurate to history. Professor Peter Wilson, an expert on war from Oxford University, helps them by advising on a new game called Total War: Medieval III. He wants to share knowledge about past wars with people through games, not just books or TV. He got involved after a developer read his book, and he helps make the games more realistic, such as showing how seasons affected battles in medieval times.

background_read: Video games can be fun and educational. Total War is a game series that lets players pretend to be leaders from history, like kings or generals, and make decisions about armies and resources. It helps people learn about different time periods, such as ancient Rome or medieval Japan. Experts like Professor Peter Wilson work with game makers to ensure the games are based on real history, making them a cool way to explore the past.
